title: Mauricio Pochettino and Tottenham stars out in London after squad arranged team bonding dinner
text:
Mauricio Pochettino and his Tottenham stars enjoyed dinner out together after the players invited their manager as a show of support.

Spurs have endured a tough start to the season and Pochettino has come under increased scrutiny but bonded with his squad on Thursday evening.

The group were pictured leaving Novikov restaurant in Mayfair, an establishment that serves both Asian and Italian cuisine.

Son Heung-min (left) and Harry Kane (right) were among the players out on the town

Mauricio Pochettino's players invited the manager out to dinner at a Mayfair restaurant

Dele Alli opted for a more casual look with ripped jeans and a white t-shirt on Thursday night

The mood appears to have lifted in the Spurs camp following their 5-0 demolition of Red Star Belgrade on Tuesday.

Pochettino dressed in a long black coat and navy jumper while Son donned a black and white striped jacket and Dele Alli appeared more casual in ripped jeans and a t-shirt.

Clearly the Argentine boss feels his players are squarely behind him, despite some speculation that he might leave the club this season.

Christian Eriksen (left) and Harry Winks (right) were also in attendance at the restaurant

Erik Lamela wore a fur-lined jacked and was pictured leaving the establishment in Mayfair

On Friday he reflected on the meal: 'It was very good, it was very nice, very kind of them to invite the coaching staff,' he said.

'It was nice, it was busy, we spent a few hours there and it is always nice to see people in a different environment.

'That doesn't mean we are going to go to Anfield and win 5-0 because we were nice all together. But it is going to help in the long-term.'

The league leaders host Spurs, who are seventh in the Premier League in Sunday's 4:30pm kick off.

Jan Vertonghen is likely to be involved this Sunday with Spurs taking on Liverpool at Anfield
description: Mauricio Pochettino and his Tottenham stars enjoyed dinner out together after the players invited their manager as a show of support.
